subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] No evidence is accptable!?
author: Lisby
full_text:
Hey guys, not to interrupt the outragefest here, but there are times  
when what you're seeing and hearing just doesn't agree with what  
someone else does. There where times when, for example, when a late  
member of another group showed me pictures where he was absolutely  
sure they showed something paranormal and all I saw was zip-- 
sometimes not even enough to blame it on pattern recognition. We'd  
argue until the old saw was trotted out, "You skeptics don't believe  
anything." I'd always assure him that I did, in fact, accept the  
reality of EVP, life after death, UFOs, time travel, and any number  
of other paranormal issues, and just because I did not perceive one  
piece of potential evidence was actually evidence, it was very unfair  
to tar and feather me.

There have been times when I heard a clear EVP and no one else did  
and times that others insisted they clearly heard one and I did not.  
(And I have to add that sometimes listening for EVPs amidst a long  
stream of bandwidth tuning diminishes them for me--it makes them  
sound much more likely to be broadcast fragments. Unless you have  
good headphones and are listening very carefully to each syllable, it  
sounds like junk.)

Also, please keep in mind that when you solicit a stranger's opinion,  
you need to accept the fact that you may not get the validation you  
are looking for. I get hundreds of supposed paranormal pics sent to  
me each year. 99.9 are camera artifacts. I only write back to the  
ones I think may be possibly paranormal because if I write back and  
say it is a camera artifact, then I end up in a slanging match with  
the person who sent it and I assure you that every conversation  
includes the sentence "Well, you skeptics don't believe anything!"

I don't know this person that all the slanging is going on about  
here, but I do know that he, like me, simply may not hear it, may not  
want to be involved for whatever reason, or may just be in a bad mood  
that someone is demanding he agree with them when he honestly  
doesn't. There is nothing wrong with that. It doesn't make him the  
twin brother of James Randi or even a simple skeptic.

Have some mercy on people who don't see with you eye to eye. Agree to  
disagree. Be good to each other, for chrissakes. This is not an all- 
or-nothing issue. And I think that once you come to the conclusion  
that you have experienced enough high strangeness to know, without a  
doubt, that the basic fact that the Other Side and far more exists,  
then the need for every possible piece of evidence to be real fades  
away. We're not looking for evidence. We have it already. We're  
looking for the best evidence possible.

/rant

Ann
